events.label: Sep 19, 2025
events.note: The House passes a 'clean' Continuing Resolution (CR). Senate Democrats oppose it, demanding inclusion of ACA tax credit extensions (as of Oct 2025).
events.source: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025

events.label: Sep 30, 2025
events.note: The Senate does not obtain required votes to advance competing funding proposals; a lapse in funding is expected at 12:01 a.m. EDT on Oct 1. House Speaker keeps House out of session (as of Oct 2025).
events.source: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 1, 2025 (12:01 am EDT)
events.note: Federal funding expires at 12:01 a.m. EDT, triggering a partial government shutdown.
bullets: About 750,000 employees furloughed
700,000 working without pay (as of Oct 14, 2025)
events.source: Major outlets; agency statements (FAA, TSA, Smithsonian), Oct 2025
events.source_cost: Major outlets; agency statements (FAA, TSA, Smithsonian), Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 1, 2025
events.note: Senate holds third vote on funding measures. Both Democratic and Republican versions fail (55–45 and 47–53). Preliminary negotiations described as 'preliminary discussion' (as of Oct 2025).
events.source: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 2, 2025
events.note: Department of Education staff report modified out-of-office emails attributing responsibility to Democrats for shutdown, potential Hatch Act violation alleged (as of Oct 2025).
events.source: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 3, 2025
events.note: Senate holds fourth vote that did not meet the threshold (54–44). Speaker Johnson extends House recess for another week, delaying Representative-elect swearing in (as of Oct 2025).
events.source: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 6, 2025 (Day 6)
events.note: First major aviation disruptions due to air traffic controller staffing shortages.
bullets: Hollywood Burbank Airport control tower closes for almost 6 hours, forcing pilots to coordinate movements themselves
Flight delays average 2.5 hours
FAA reports controller shortages in Boston, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Houston
Delays spread to Nashville, Dallas, Newark
TSA reports increase in unscheduled absences among security screeners
events.cost: First major aviation disruptions; 6-hour ATC closure
events.source: Major outlets; agency statements (FAA, TSA, Smithsonian), Oct 2025
events.source_cost: Major outlets; agency statements (FAA, TSA, Smithsonian), Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 10, 2025 (Day 10)
events.note: Aviation disruptions escalates and mass federal layoffs begin.
bullets: USDA announces $300 million in tariff revenue to temporarily fund WIC program through October
FAA reports 12 facilities short-staffed
Transportation Sec. Sean Duffy confirms air traffic controllers calling out sick
Over 6,000 flights per day facing delays (nearly double October historical average)
TSA stops updating real-time checkpoint information on MyTSA app
At least 4,200 federal employees receive permanent RIF notices across seven agencies
events.cost: 6,000+ daily flight delays; WIC temporary funding; 4,200+ RIF notices
events.source: Major outlets; agency statements (FAA, TSA, Smithsonian), Oct 2025
events.source_cost: Major outlets; agency statements (FAA, TSA, Smithsonian), Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 12, 2025 (Day 12)
events.note: Major cultural institutions close and aviation delays persist.
bullets: All 21 Smithsonian museums, research centers, and National Zoo close after exhausting prior-year funds
Affects nearly 17 million annual visitors
National Gallery of Art and U.S. Capitol Visitor Center also close
Air traffic running average 30 minutes behind schedule nationwide
Speaker Johnson warns shutdown approaching longest in American history
events.cost: All Smithsonian institutions closed; sustained flight delays
events.source: Major outlets; agency statements (FAA, TSA, Smithsonian), Oct 2025
events.source_cost: Major outlets; agency statements (FAA, TSA, Smithsonian), Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 14, 2025 (Day 14)
events.note: Eighth Senate vote does not obtain required votes as President announces military pay workaround.
bullets: Senate holds eighth vote on funding bill at 5:30 PM ET, fails without 60-vote threshold (56-44)
President Trump announces $8 billion reallocation from prior-year Pentagon R&D funds to pay military personnel on Oct 15
DHS Sec. Kristi Noem separately pays Coast Guard
CDC fires approximately 600 employees (1,300 initially notified, 700 reinstated due to data errors)
Multiple major airports refuse to display Noem's video blaming Democrats for shutdown
events.cost: Day 14; 600 CDC employees terminated; 8th Senate vote fails
events.source: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025
events.source_cost: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025

events.label: Oct 15, 2025 (Day 15)
events.note: Senate prepares for ninth vote as federal workers miss first paychecks.
bullets: Senate prepares for ninth vote on House-passed continuing resolution, expected to fail again
Military personnel (1.3M active duty + 750K+ Guard/Reserve) and Coast Guard receive paychecks from reallocated funds
Other 750,000+ federal workers miss first regular paychecks
House Republicans cancel all votes for the week
Over 13,000 air traffic controllers face financial strain; NATCA union warns of increased safety risks
Aviation system continues experiencing 6,000+ daily flight delays
events.cost: Day 15; first missed paychecks for 750K+ workers; aviation crisis continues
events.source: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025
events.source_cost: Congressional records and major outlets, Sep–Oct 2025
